primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God creates a new world (New Jerusalem) where suffering is abolished, and the hearer must prepare for this by a process of moral 'decreasing'.

tekstueel_bewijs: God will bless and make the force of life everywhere palpably available
take as your Advent work... decrease/increase

object.identificatie: The New Creation / Shalom / Life-giving power
tekstueel_bewijs: New heaven, new earth, new Jerusalem
every person will live safely under a vine and fig tree
this poet does the proper work of poetry
we are the baptized people who have promised to share such a text
it will be a world of rejoicing when the newness comes
we shall never be left alone again
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist (as a model) and the Gospel Narrative
tekstueel_bewijs: John embodies the best and the last of the old tradition
the evangelical antidote to our fatigue
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject of the vision, but the Helper of the hearer's effort.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human cynicism, fatigue, and 'the old' (greed, fear, fraud)
tekstueel_bewijs: our fatigue, our self-sufficiency, and our cynicism
the killing in which we are much practiced
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily internal/dispositional rather than a cosmic power of Sin or Death that requires a Savior.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Advent Work' of the hearer to decrease the old self to allow the new to grow.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon suggests God does the 'large' work but the hearer must do the 'small' work to make the large work 'not sound so outrageous'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist → The Hearer ← Cynicism/Greed

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will do much to bring the promises

voorbeelden: He must increase, I must decrease
It requires... the daily work of decreasing
Advent is a demanding piece of work
we seize the vision in craving
Recognize the danger you are in
God will not do our work of redeciding our life

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the obligation (Devoir) of the hearer to perform 'Advent work' because God 'will not do' the work of redeciding life.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Vision) to S2 (Reality) to ~S2 (Discipline) as the bridge back to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Synergistic: God provides the vision, man provides the 'decrease' to make the vision palpable.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; cynicism is treated as a fatigue rather than a spiritual death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the vision is theocentric (God creates the new world), the application is heavily moralistic, placing the burden of 'making the newness happen' or 'making it believable' on human discipline.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: As the gifts... may increase for us... We begin to hear the rustle of new heaven

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human as Primary Actor in Sanctification
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God will not do our work of redeciding our life.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is used as the model for the hearer's 'small discipline'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: John as the one who points to the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world (Subject = Jesus).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform 'Advent work' to validate the vision.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a human work that precedes the experience of eschatological joy.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'outrageous' cosmic act of God to the 'small' moral work of the hearer creates a structural disconnect.
spanning_punten: God is the Subject of the New Creation, but the Hearer is the Subject of 'redeciding life'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Decrease what is greedy... for the increase of life-giving sharing.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon lacks a mention of the Spirit as the one who grants the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is described as 'habitual' and 'sickness' rather than a total inability.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon starts with God as the Subject of a cosmic narrative but ends with the Hearer as the Subject of a moral narrative.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is told God 'will not' do the work of redeciding life.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Present Christ as the one who 'decreases' our old self through the Cross.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Decrease what is greedy', use 'In Christ, your greed has been put to death, so that His generosity may live through you.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' of the New Jerusalem.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'newness' is a gift to be received, not a result of the 'decrease'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'outrageous' God gives us the power to change, rather than demanding it as a prerequisite.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify Sin as a power we cannot break by 'daily disciplines' alone.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: A stronger Opponent necessitates a stronger Savior (Subject-switch).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's act) must be the ground of Ethics, not the goal.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The vision of Isaiah is beautifully rendered, but the homiletical move to John the Baptist shifts the weight of the 'New Creation' onto human effort. Reclaiming Christ as the Subject of the 'decrease' would transform this from a moral challenge into a grace-filled proclamation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would praise the 'decrease/increase' parallelism; Greimas exposes that this parallelism makes the hearer the Subject of their own salvation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Isaiah; Greimas focuses on the functional roles assigned to God and the congregation in the present moment.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals the 'Subject-switch' in Section III where the 'outrageous God' is sidelined for the 'demanding work' of the hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses high-grace language ('outrageous', 'gift') but the underlying actantial engine is 'Devoir-faire' (obligation).
